Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util

Class LoginToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util.LoginToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class LoginToken
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A LoginToken contains the expiration date and token string to be passed to API calls by clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createSecure

        public static LoginToken createSecure​(java.lang.String userId)
        Create a secure token for the given user ID. Uses java.security.SecureRandom internally with a year-long expiration.
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to create the token for. This becomes the public part / access key of the token.
        Returns:
        A LoginToken object.

      • expiration

        public static java.util.Date expiration()

      • getSecret

        public java.lang.String getSecret()
        Get the secret portion of the token string.
        Returns:
        The token secret.

      • getAccessKey

        public java.lang.String getAccessKey()
        Get the public portion of the token string (typically the User ID).
        Returns:
        The token access key.

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        Gets the complete login token clients should use in the HTTP API's X-Auth-Token header.
        Returns:
        The token.

      • setToken

        public void setToken​(java.lang.String token)

      • getExpiresAt

        public java.util.Date getExpiresAt()
        Gets the token's expiration date.
        Returns:
        The token's expiration date.
